channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Ukraine's last eastern strongholds hang on as Russia fights to take Donbas
item.description: Russia is pushing to take over all of eastern Ukraine's Donbas region, where one resident tells NPR that she feels her "life depends on how our guys a...

item.title: Trump to address affordability. And, the significance of Indiana's redistricting fight
item.description: Trump travels to Pennsylvania to discuss America's affordability. And, Indiana lawmakers to vote on a congressional map that may eliminate the state's...

item.title: Rising temperatures could have a chilling impact on young children
item.description: A study points to a new concern about the effect that heat can have on young children.

item.title: Believe it or not, this book makes taxes fascinating
item.description: The Price of Democracy tells the history of taxation from colonization to the present day. It's essential reading for anyone who cares about preservin...

item.title: Millions of borrowers in Biden's SAVE plan would start paying under new settlement
item.description: Legal challenges put SAVE borrowers in limbo for months, a time during which they were not required to make payments on their loans. That would change...

item.title: Bruce Blakeman announces run for New York governor
item.description: Blakeman, the two-term Nassau County executive, formally launched his 2026 campaign for governor of New York early Tuesday morning.

item.title: Nobel officials unsure when Peace Prize winner will arrive for ceremony
item.description: Venezuela's opposition leader María Corina Machado is in hiding, and her current whereabouts are still unknown.

item.title: These young Australians grew up with social media - what do they think of the ban?
item.description: The BBC took to the streets of Sydney to find out what young people aged between 18 and 20 think of Australia’s under-16s social media ban.

item.title: 3 important mortgage rate questions to ask after this week's Fed rate cut
item.description: A looming Fed rate cut presents new openings (and timely mortgage rate questions worth answering) for homebuyers.

item.title: Why fighting inflation may not be the best way to make life more affordable
item.description: Beating back inflation is only half the battle in lowering the cost of living — you also have to think about people's pay, economists argue.

item.title: Illinois law protects immigrants from arrest near courthouses, hospitals or colleges

Opponents of Trump-backed redistricting in Missouri submit a petition to force a public vote
item.description: Opponents of Missouri’s new congressional map have submitted thousands of petition signatures calling for a statewide referendum on the plan backed by...

item.title: Shooting at Kentucky State University injures several, governor says
item.description: A suspect has been arrested following a reported shooting at Kentucky State University on Tuesday, according to Gov. Andy Beshear.

item.title: Tanzania crackdown on planned protest leaves streets deserted
item.description: There is a large police presence in major cities and the authorities have encouraged people to stay home.

item.title: Can you have both a HELOC and a home equity loan?
item.description: Thinking about pairing home equity products? There are a few things you should know before you try.

item.title: Trump criticises 'decaying' European countries and 'weak' leaders
item.description: The UK praises Europe's "strength" after Trump says countries fail to control migration or take action to end the Ukraine war.

item.title: Jakarta office fire kills at least 22, police confirm
item.description: The blaze in the Indonesian capital breaks out as office workers take their lunch break.
